intro: Calceolaria × gellaniana, commonly known as the hybrid slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves, and it thrives in well-drained soil with moderate sunlight. Calceolaria × gellaniana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
